# Reference template

Use this template for technical reference documentation like API documentation, configuration options, or command-line reference.

## When to use this template

Use reference documentation for:

- API or action documentation
- Configuration file reference
- Command-line interface reference
- Schema or data format specifications
- Complete lists of options or parameters

Examples:

- Doc Detective action reference (`find`, `click`, `type`, etc.)
- Configuration file schema
- CLI command reference
- Environment variables reference

## Template

Copy and adapt this template for your reference documentation:

````markdown
---
title: [API/command/option name]
description: [One-sentence description of what this does]
---

# [Name]

[2-3 sentences explaining what this is and when to use it.]

## Syntax

[Show the basic syntax pattern. Use a code block.]

```[language]
[Syntax pattern with placeholders]
```

## Parameters

[Table of all parameters/options/properties.]

| Parameter | Type    | Required | Default | Description              |
| --------- | ------- | -------- | ------- | ------------------------ |
| param1    | string  | Yes      | -       | What this parameter does |
| param2    | number  | No       | 10      | What this parameter does |
| param3    | boolean | No       | false   | What this parameter does |

### param1

[Detailed description if needed.]

**Type:** string  
**Required:** Yes

[Additional details, constraints, or important notes.]

### param2

[Detailed description if needed.]

**Type:** number  
**Required:** No  
**Default:** 10  
**Valid values:** 1-100

[Additional details, constraints, or important notes.]

## Return value

[For APIs: What does this return? For commands: What's the output?]

**Type:** [Return type]

[Description of what's returned.]

## Examples

### Basic example

[Show the simplest possible usage.]

```[language] title="[filename if applicable]"
[Code]
```

[Brief explanation of what this example does.]

### Example with [specific feature]

[Show usage with additional options.]

```[language] title="[filename if applicable]"
[Code]
```

[Brief explanation of what this example demonstrates.]

### Advanced example

[Show more complex usage combining multiple features.]

```[language] title="[filename if applicable]"
[Code]
```

[Brief explanation of the advanced usage.]

## Remarks

[Optional: Important notes, behaviors, limitations, or caveats.]

- Important note 1
- Important note 2
- Known limitation

## See also

[Link to related reference documentation.]

- [Related item 1](#)
- [Related item 2](#)
- [Tutorial using this](#)
````

## Writing tips

### Be precise and complete

Reference documentation should be authoritative:

✅ Good:

**Type:** `string | number`<br/> **Required:** No<br/> **Default:** `"auto"`<br/> **Valid values:** `"auto"`, `"light"`, `"dark"`, or any number 0-100

⛔ Vague:

Theme setting (optional)

### Use consistent structure

All entries in a reference should follow the same pattern:

✅ Consistent:

- Every parameter has: Type, Required, Default (if applicable), Description
- Every example has: Code block, Explanation
- Every section appears in the same order

### Document edge cases

Reference docs should cover unusual behavior:

✅ Complete:

> If `timeout` is set to `0`, the action waits indefinitely. If `timeout` is negative, it defaults to 5000 ms.

⛔ Incomplete:

> The timeout value in milliseconds.

### Provide multiple examples

Show common use cases:

✅ Good examples:

- Basic: Minimal configuration
- Intermediate: Common options
- Advanced: Complex real-world usage
- Edge case: Unusual but valid usage

### Link to related content

Help users discover related information:

```markdown
## See also

- **Conceptual**: [Understanding test contexts](/docs/concepts/contexts)
- **How-to**: [How to configure contexts](/docs/how-to/configure-contexts)
- **Related actions**: [goTo action](/docs/references/goto)
```

## Checklist before submitting

- [ ] Syntax section shows clear usage pattern
- [ ] All parameters are documented in a table
- [ ] Each parameter has: type, required status, default (if applicable), description
- [ ] Complex parameters have detailed subsections
- [ ] Return value is documented (if applicable)
- [ ] At least 3 examples provided (basic, intermediate, advanced)
- [ ] Important remarks or limitations are noted
- [ ] Related documentation is linked
- [ ] All examples have been tested

## Related templates

- **[How-To](how-to)**: For task-oriented guides using this reference
- **[Tutorial](tutorial)**: For learning-oriented guides
- **[Feature](feature)**: For documenting new features
- **[Troubleshooting](troubleshooting)**: For problem-solution documentation
```
